title: Love Island Australia Maurice Salib's ex calls him a 'narcissist' and says she's GLAD he dumped her
text:
The jilted ex-girlfriend of Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib has taken yet another public swipe at her former flame.

Appearing on The Kyle And Jackie O Show on Wednesday, Instagram model Christie Swadling accused Maurice of being fame hungry and said she's glad he dumped her two weeks before appearing on the show.

'He's messed with the wrong person. I'm a YouTuber and you know if you stuff with us, we'll make a video about you,' the blonde declared.

'He's messed with the wrong person!' Love Island Australia Maurice Salib's (right) ex-girlfriend Christie Swadling (left) has called him a 'narcissist' and says she's GLAD he dumped her

'Watching [him on Love Island Australia], I'm not actually sad. I'm quite glad now after seeing his narcissistic behaviour on TV,' she added.

Christie said that she and Maurice dated for about 'four or five months' and that things were getting serious before he dumped her.

'I've seen the family, he had keys to my apartment,' she said, adding that she and Maurice both wanted 'a serious kind of thing'

No trip to Fiji planned: Despite her frustrations, Christie said she has no desire to enter the Love Island Australia villa to confront Maurice

'To me it makes no sense. He's ended love to go find love on the show,' she complained.

Despite her frustrations, Christie said she has no desire to enter the Love Island Australia villa to confront Maurice.

It's the latest in a series of public rants about Maurice from Christie, who savagely labelled him as 'trash' on Instagram during Monday night's premiere.

Jilted: Christie (pictured) claims he left her TWO WEEKS before going on the show - despite him saying he's been single for six months

'To me it makes no sense. He's ended love to go find love on the show': Maurice features prominently on Christie's Instagram page, and is seen in various amorous poses with the blonde

On Tuesday, she unleashed on the social media content creator yet again, posting a fiery tell-all uploaded to YouTube.

During the video, which is brazenly titled 'MY BOYFRIEND DUMPED ME FOR A DATING SHOW', Christie claimed that 'fame loving' Maurice called time on their romance two weeks ago, and said she was blindsided to soon discover he was a contestant on Love Island Australia.

It's war! Christie savagely labelled Maurice (pictured) as 'trash' on Instagram during Monday night's premiere

'I'm getting so many messages from you guys asking what the hell is happening, and why are they seeing my 'boyfriend' all over the ads and everything to do with a dating show,' the Instagram model began.

'If you go and have a look you should be able to see from all my socials... I have been dating a guy for the past few months now named Maurice,' she explained.

'In the past two weeks, everyone's realised he's not in my socials and then boom he's on this dating show,' the visibly-irate blonde huffed.

'My boyfriend dumped me for Love Island Australia!' On Tuesday, she unleashed on the social media content creator yet again, posting a fiery tell-all uploaded to YouTube

She proceeded to claim that Maurice had lied in his official Love Island bio when he claimed he's been single for six months.

'Did he lie in his bio? Yes. We were together within that [six month] time frame,' she declared.

She then turned to the question of whether she knew Maurice would be on Love Island before he dumped her.

We were together within that time frame!' In the video, she claimed that Maurice had lied in his official Love Island bio when he claimed he's been single for six months

'I had no idea he was going on the dating show, whatsoever. But he came to me while we were together saying that [Channel Nine had] asked him to go on the [television] ad [for Love Island].'

Explaining that Maurice has always had aspirations to become an actor, Christie said she didn't hesitate to encourage him to appear in the advertisement.

'He's wanted to be an actor, he does a little bit of acting as a side job. When the ad was released, everyone was messaging me saying, 'Oh my god is Maurice going on Love Island?' And I was like, 'No it's just the ad he's just an actor',' she explained.

'About one week after he's gone on this ad, he's broken it off with me!' she exclaimed, adding that his sudden dumping was 'completely out of the blue'.

'His excuse was saying that he puts work first and he can't really prioritise me,' she said.

'He's wanted to be an actor!' Explaining that Maurice (right) has always had aspirations to become an actor, Christie (left) said she didn't hesitate to encourage him to appear in the advertisement
description: The jilted ex-girlfriend of Love Island Australia's Maurice Salib has taken yet another public swipe at her former flame.
authors: Monique Friedlander For Daily Mail Australia
